name: vocally
content:
vocally adverb
(OF THE VOICE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to or is produced by the voice, either in singing or speaking: This song really shows what she can do vocally. He is very musically and vocally talented.
More examplesFewer examplesShe is really secure in the role, and vocally she has no problems whatsoever.He wasn't particularly suited vocally to this kind of opera.Other animals can communicate vocally and by gesture.

Ways of speaking
vocally adverb
(OF OPINIONS)
by expressing opinions and complaints often: She was vocally opposed to the war. She vocally supports opening the wildlife refuge for oil drilling. See
vocal
More examplesFewer examplesThey were visibly and vocally upset.He complained vocally about the company's market dominance.The organization has vocally advocated restructuring of UN agencies to better serve women.
